hey folks, pattern matching incubator call happening right now in case folks forgot

second update: cancelling, folks didn't show, might've not seen the finalized time since i finalized it kinda late last week. also didn't get a satisfying answer yet to mark's question of who outside the champion group would like to participate
will update the reflector thread
So now I'm getting GitHub workflow email, for both jmdyck/ecma262 and tc39/ecma262.
i think that’s expected; GitHub actions is a bit email-happy
I can mostly see what it's about, but I'm puzzled by one set
where the subject is "[tc39/ecma262] PR run failed: Upload Preview - merchant-center-1546635176041 (80efe41)"
what the heck is "merchant-center-1546635176041" ?
I don't have a branch or PR with that name.
hm - does anyone?
the upload preview task runs on tc39/ecma262 when any pull request finishes the “build preview” step
since you have write access, you might receive an email like that for every PR
Shouldn't the email tell me which PR or branch it's trying to do the upload preview for?
I’d think so, but the way workflow_run tasks work is that that info is all buried in an event payload
Apparently the Upload Preview job is failing because scripts/publish-preview throws "ReferenceError: Missing env var PULL_REQUEST"
But workflows/preview.yml does appear to be setting the PULL_REQUEST env var for the run of publish-preview.
So is the problem that `${{ github.event.workflow_run.pull_requests['0'].number }}` isn't defined?
content.formatted_body: So is the problem that ${{ github.event.workflow_run.pull_requests['0'].number }} isn't defined?

content.body: yes, that's the issue i'm working through right now with it
it was defined when i was testing on my fork, but it seems not to be now, so i need to find another way to convey it

someone wanna update this citation (which currently points to a 404) to something else? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECMAScript#cite_note-ES2021-9 does ES2021 have a permalink on Ecma's site? should it link to https://www.ecma-international.org/news/ecma-international-approves-new-standards-4/ ?
I'd say the permalink is https://262.ecma-international.org/12.0/
Seems like the url that's there (http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/12.0/) *should* work, but Ecma hasn't set up the redirect.
content.formatted_body: Seems like the url that's there (http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/12.0/) should work, but Ecma hasn't set up the redirect.

content.body: I'll do some fixing.
